intro: Satureja calamintha var. mollis, commonly known as soft mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink to purple. Its leaves are soft and fuzzy, contributing to its common name, and it is often used in herbal teas and as a spice. This variety is valued for its medicinal properties and its ability to thrive in well-drained, rocky soils.
